Articles.Content:
1.0.2 brought many challenges, one of my biggest was getting the Jet ATV working, the water physics seem to have changed and as we all know so did the aerodynamics making this version the hardest to date to get this craft working but finally i have it there again and i am proud to present the

**Jet ATV mk7**

![E2DSURd.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/E2DSURd.jpg)

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/y01p8K76XlY?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

**Description:** 

Capable of 350+kmh across land and water the jet ATV is everything you could possibly want in a Kerbin rover, with enough fuel to go for hundreds of kilometers you are sure to kill a few kerbals in high speed crashes across the planet with this thing. 

**Driving instructions:** 

For the most part you will figure it out but i will say this, avoid going into the water at over 30m/s and avoid putting the wheels down while in the water above those speeds, it tends to cause bad things to happen.

**Download link:** 

[**http://www./download/t7688775f5ujyx7/Jet+ATV+mk7.craft**](http://www./download/t7688775f5ujyx7/Jet+ATV+mk7.craft)
One of the best looking versions of your ATV. Nice! I especially like how the look of the airbrake control system turned out.

> 
> Holy crap.

Haha thanks man, thought you might enjoy this one ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Are those reaction wheels at the front only for looks? Because they won't function very well this way. You should put them as close to the center of mass to be effective (they generate a torque, not a force like thrusters).

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-21T09:54:21Z" title="05/21/2015 09:54  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 21, 2015</time> by Chris\_2**
